body.p:
No. 22.
The State of Kentucky,
To Hiram, L, Coldiron Dr.

row.cell: For Services rendered, recruiting for 49th Kentucky Vols, from July 26. 1864, until February 1st 1865

body.p: Said Hiram. L, Coldiron was captured by the enemy Previous to being mustered into the U. S. service and was retained in Confinement until Feby 1st 1865, as is shown by the accompanying Certificates of his Company Commander and is hereby ordered to be Paid

D. W. Lindsey
Adjt Genl Ky

p.hi: I Certify that the above account is correct and just; that the services were rendered as stated; and that they were necessary for the public service, and will be reported on my return of for the month ending the day of 1865.

body.p: Captain and Assistant Quarter-Master Ky. Vols.

Received at Frankfort, Kentucky, the 19 of May, 1865, of S. G. SUDDARTH, Quarter-Master General of the State of Kentucky, the sum of Two Hundred & Thirty Seven Dollars, and sixty six -- Cents, in full of the above account.
